response.body:
[
    {
        "id": 44,
        "question": "State the Doppler effect in words.",
        "type": "multiple_choice",
        "context": "An ambulance is moving away from a stationary listener with a constant velocity of 25 ms-1. The siren of the ambulance emits sound waves at a frequency of 550 Hz. The listener detects the frequency of these sound waves\nto be 512,64 Hz.\n\nIgnore the effects of wind.\n",
        "answer": "[\"The change in frequency (pitch) of the sound detected by a listener because the sound source and the listener have different velocities relative to the medium of sound propagation. \"]",
        "options": {
            "option1": "The Doppler effect is the phenomenon where light waves change color due to variations in the temperature of the emitting source.",
            "option2": "The Doppler effect describes how the intensity of a sound increases as the sound source moves away from the listener.",
            "option3": "The change in frequency (pitch) of the sound detected by a listener because the sound source and the listener have different velocities relative to the medium of sound propagation. ",
            "option4": "The Doppler effect refers to the sensation of hearing echo sounds in a large empty space."
        },
        "term": 2,
        "explanation": "",
        "active": true,
        "year": 2023,
        "answer_image": "679b625a5554d.png",
        "capturer": "mnelisi079@gmail.com",
        "status": "approved",
        "reviewer": "",
        "created": "2025-02-02T18:47:08+00:00",
        "subject": {
            "id": 28,
            "name": "Physical Sciences P1",
            "active": true,
            "grade": {
                "id": 1,
                "number": 12,
                "active": 1
            }
        }
    }
]

{
    "id": 250,
    "question": "Name the structure in the ear where the organ of Corti is located.\n\n",
    "type": "single",
    "context": "Workers in some factories are constantly exposed to loud noise for long periods. This can destroy the hair cells in the organ of Corti and damage the auditory nerve, resulting in hearing loss.\nA survey was conducted in a developing country from 2014 to 2018, to establish the number of factory workers who suffered from hearing loss.\n\nThe results are shown in the table\n",
    "answer": "[\"Cochlea\"]",
    "options": {

        "option2": "",
